newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Key Australian budget vote seen Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Key Australian budget vote seen Wednesday.

text.p: The Australian Senate, the upper house of parliament, will probably decide one of the bigger contentious budget bills on Wednesday, Senate sources said.
Non-government parties have already tried and failed to amend the bill, which would increase students' university charges and the rate at which they repay their debts.
More than a quarter of the government's planned fiscal tightening is in doubt in the Senate.
The government announced measures in its August budget that would save A$7.2 billion next fiscal year (from July).
The main non-government parties are opposed to about A$2 billion of that, leaving the government relying on the doubtful support of two Independents.
This bill, the Higher Education Amendment Bill, is worth about A$300 million in 1997/98.
The two Independents sided with the government on Tuesday in voting down an attempt to amend the bill.
The Senate has dealt with almost none of the other contentious budget bills but is supposed to finish them by the end of next week.
